location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:155 x 205 mmFormat:1 b&w silver gelatin printCondition:The image is in good condition with minimal fading.Process:Gelatin silver print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This aerial view of the coastline of Ras Al-Hadd (Ra’s al Ḩadd) looking north was taken on 4 February 1932 by the R.A.F. during a reconnaissance mission in advance of a planned bombardment of Aiqa and Jaalan (Ja‘alān) described in following folios, f. 129-130.The inscriptions in the upper right corner probably refer to camera settings, as well as date and time of capture.Inscriptions:Recto, directly into negative, upper right corner: 203.B.349.P RAS-AL-HADD.LG 4.2.32.0910 F10". 2000'Verso, ink stamp: 'ROYAL AIR FORCE OFFICIAL CROWN COPYRIGHT [illegible] U203 Date 18/2/32'; 'FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY'Temporal Context:Prints produced on 18 February 1932. Photographs taken on 4 February 1932, likely at 09.10am.
